module.iface

Interface Provider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Module
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProsumerProvider, AbstractProvider

    public interface Provider
extends Module
    Basic interface for all modules implementing a provider.

    USAGE: You must not implement this interface. Instead extend one of the following abstract implementations and provide a constructor accepting the specified objects that does the corresponding super() call:
    AbstractProsumerProvider -> ProsumerConnector, ProviderConnector, ComponentConfigurationController, LogConnector
    AbstractProvider -> ProviderConnector, ComponentConfigurationController, LogConnector

    IMPORTANT: Methods in this class must be thread-safe.

    TODO:
    - Currently some methods may return null values on error. This should be avoided. Exceptions should be used instead.
    - Only use int values from ErrorCodes as return values, not this positive/negative number mix.
    - Additional methods: isReadwrite(), isReadOnly(), getMimeType(), canMonitor().

    Author:
    Stefan Werner

    • Method Detail

      • checkAndLock

        int checkAndLock(ProviderPort port,
                 java.lang.String[] path)
          throws ModuleException
        Checks if an element is already locked and locks it if possible. How this is done is up to the implementation. Should be reentrant (return OK if already locked by this instance).
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        0 if successfully locked, ErrorCodes.EROFS if read-only file system, ErrorCodes.EINVAL if invalid path, ErrorCodes.ENOENT if element not existing, ErrorCodes.ENOSYS if not supported, ErrorCodes.EIO if IO error occurred
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • createFolder

        int createFolder(ProviderPort port,
                 java.lang.String[] path)
          throws ModuleException
        Creates a folder. If necessary parent folders are created automatically.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result code, 0 = OK, -1 = readonly, >1 = error, 1 = exists
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • delete

        int delete(ProviderPort port,
           java.lang.String[] path)
    throws ModuleException
        Deletes an element at a given path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result code, 0 = OK, -1 = read-only, 1 non-existing, >1 = error
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • getChildElements

        java.util.Set<DataElement> getChildElements(ProviderPort port,
                                            java.lang.String[] path,
                                            boolean recursive)
                                     throws ModuleException
        Gets the child elements under a given parent path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        recursive - set to true to get all children recursively (relative depth >= 1)
        Returns:
        the child elements (null if non existing/error or no children supported, for example within file elements)
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • getElement

        DataElement getElement(ProviderPort port,
                       java.lang.String[] path)
                throws ModuleException
        Gets the element at a given path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the element (null if non existing or error)
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • getType

        DataElementType getType(ProviderPort port,
                        java.lang.String[] path)
                 throws ModuleException
        Gets the type of the element at a given path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the type (null if no such element)
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • move

        int move(ProviderPort port,
         java.lang.String[] srcPath,
         java.lang.String[] destPath)
  throws ModuleException
        Moves an element from one path to another within the same port. If necessary parent folders for destination are created automatically. Will NOT overwrite an existing destination element.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        srcPath - the source path
        destPath - the destination path
        Returns:
        the result code, 0 = OK, 1 = source non existent, 2 = destination exists, >2 = error
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • onStateRequest

        void onStateRequest(ProviderPort port)
        Requests the module state.

        USAGE: Return the current state by calling ProviderConnector.sendState(framework.model.Port, int).

        Parameters:
        port - the port

      • readData

        java.io.InputStream readData(ProviderPort port,
                             java.lang.String[] path)
                      throws ModuleException
        Reads data from an element at given path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the input stream to read from (null if no such element or no data)
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • unlock

        int unlock(ProviderPort port,
           java.lang.String[] path)
    throws ModuleException
        Unlocks an element at given path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result code, 0 = OK, 4 = already locked, -1 = not supported
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • writeData

        java.io.OutputStream writeData(ProviderPort port,
                               java.lang.String[] path)
                        throws ModuleException
        Writes data to an element at given path, creates it if necessary (including parent folders).
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the output stream to write to (null if read only)
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs
